name: sultriness
content:
sultriness noun [U]
(WEATHER)
Add to word list
Add to word list
(of weather) the quality of being uncomfortably warm and with air that is slightly wet: No sounds break the heavy sultriness of the afternoon. The day's earlier sultriness had passed without a storm.
More examplesFewer examplesThe rain brought relief from the heavy sultriness.I'll never forget the overpowering sultriness of the afternoon. There is a damp and oppressive sultriness under the thick, leafy canopy.

sultriness noun [U]
(SEXY)
(especially of a woman's face or voice) the quality of being attractive in a way that suggests sexual desire: I love the sultriness of her voice when she sings. She uses her long eyelashes and come-hither smile to create a smouldering sultriness.
More examplesFewer examplesShe exudes an approachable yet exotic sultriness.She locks eyes with the lens and in her best sultriness introduces herself.Unlike the overly-breathy sultriness of recent efforts, her singing style here is strong and effortless.
